message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The droplike, erythematous papules with fine silver scales suggest a diagnosis of guttate psoriasis, which can be triggered by a streptococcal infection like the sore throat the patient had a few weeks ago. Bullous pemphigoid and Pemphigus vulgaris are autoimmune diseases that present with blistering and erosions, while plaque psoriasis presents with well-demarcated raised plaques.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The droplike erythematous papules with silver scales are characteristic of guttate psoriasis. The other options do not present with the same type of lesions.

Bullous pemphigoid and pemphigus vulgaris are blistering autoimmune diseases, while plaque psoriasis presents as red, scaly patches.
